intro: Pavia intermedia, commonly known as the common pavia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-white in color, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. The botanical features of Pavia intermedia make it adaptable to various soil types and environmental conditions.
